title: Lead Qualifier & Appointment Setter
description:
We are a fast-growing, multiple six-figure tutoring company based in Michigan, USA. While we provide academic support across multiple subjects (Math, English, Science, Foreign Languages), SAT prep is our primary focus and core offering.



Due to continued growth in demand for our SAT programs, we are expanding our team and hiring an additional full-time member to support our increasing volume of inbound SAT leads. Although most of our clients are local to Michigan, we proudly serve families across the U.S.



The Role

You will call warm parent leads who opted in through our SAT-focused
 ads and scheduled a 5-minute SAT Accelerator callback. Your primary responsibility is simple and focused:



Have a short, professional phone conversation with parents and secure a 30-minute SAT Skills Assessment via Zoom with one of our SAT Specialists.



‚Ä¢ Average call duration: 4‚Äì6 minutes.

‚Ä¢ Calls are made using the WAVV power dialer in GHL (GoHighLevel), creating a fast, seamless workflow.

‚Ä¢ You are not responsible for closing sales or enrolling families into the program.



All calls are made by following a detailed, step-by-step script that we provide. This role rewards clear delivery, confidence, and consistency, not improvisation.



Core Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Call warm SAT-focused parent leads who have already requested information or a callback.

‚Ä¢ Use the WAVV power dialer to efficiently move through scheduled callbacks.

‚Ä¢ Follow a detailed call script to ensure consistent, professional conversations.

‚Ä¢ Build rapport with parents while staying structured and on-script.

‚Ä¢ Gather key student background information (grade, testing history, goals).

‚Ä¢ Confidently answer common questions using approved SAT talking points.

‚Ä¢ Book qualified leads for Zoom appointments with our SAT Specialists.

‚Ä¢ Follow up with previously contacted or missed-call leads.

‚Ä¢ Accurately track call outcomes, notes, and lead status/disposition in our CRM (GoHighLevel).



Performance Expectations

‚Ä¢ Expected pace after ramp-up: 16‚Äì24 qualified Zoom bookings per day.

‚Ä¢ Consistent adherence to scripts and workflows.

‚Ä¢ Strong attention to detail when documenting calls.

‚Ä¢ Ability to stay composed, persuasive, and efficient on short (4‚Äì6 minute) calls.



What We‚Äôre Looking For

‚Ä¢ Excellent spoken English (clear, fluent, confident; neutral or native-level accent).

‚Ä¢ Prior experience in appointment setting, lead qualification, or phone-based customer interaction.

‚Ä¢ Comfortable following scripts while sounding natural and conversational.

‚Ä¢ Strong rapport-building skills with parents.

‚Ä¢ Coachable, reliable, and performance-driven.



Technical & Environment Requirements

‚Ä¢ Laptop or desktop with at least 16 GB RAM.

‚Ä¢ High-speed, stable internet (backup connection preferred).

‚Ä¢ Quiet, professional workspace.

‚Ä¢ Noise-canceling headset.

‚Ä¢ Ability to work Michigan / EST hours (40 hours per week).

‚Ä¢ Backup power or contingency plan for outages (strongly preferred).



IMPORTANT: Please apply only if you already have a second monitor or are willing to set one up within your first 7 days. A dual-monitor setup is essential for this role.



Compensation & Benefits

* 100% remote.

* Paid every Friday.



Weekly Payment Structure

Note: Compensation is earned only for qualified Zoom show-up and is calculated weekly as follows:

* 1 through 50: $5 per qualified Zoom show-up

* 51 through 60: $6 per qualified Zoom show-up

* 61 and above: $7 per qualified Zoom show-up

* 80 and above: A one-time $50 bonus each week



How to Apply

1. Watch this video and follow all instructions carefully:



2. Submit a link to your CV (Google Drive or similar). Please make sure we can access/view it.

3. Include a short audio or video recording of you speaking in English (introduce yourself and explain why you‚Äôre a good fit).



Important Notes

‚Ä¢ We are hiring freelancers / independent contractors only.

‚Ä¢ Attention to detail matters. Applicants who do not follow instructions will not receive a reply.

‚Ä¢ Do not message our social media accounts or
 addresses.

‚Ä¢ Do not call our company lines or personal phone numbers. Doing so will result in immediate disqualification.



Hiring Process

‚Ä¢ Due to the high volume of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

‚Ä¢ Qualified applicants will be invited to an interview within one week.

*Preferred Qualifications



Experience in solar, home services, or appointment-based sales

Strong script optimization and objection-handling skills

Metrics-driven and process-oriented mindset



*What Success Looks Like



Consistent daily appointment output

Clean compliance practices with low complaint rates

A motivated team that respects leadership because you‚Äôre actively involved

title: Mental Healthcare Enrollment Specialist, Medical Secretary, Medication Refills Specialist, Patient Care Coordinator
description:
Job Title: Enrollment Specialist, Medical Secretary, Medication Refills Specialist, Patient Care Coordinator



About the Job

We are an established outpatient medical practice seeking a detail-oriented, reliable, and compassionate professional to join our virtual team. At Pacific Mind Health, we are committed to delivering a patient-centered healthcare experience built on respect, integrity, teamwork, and exceptional service.



In this role, you will support key functions such as new patient enrollment, scheduling, administrative coordination, and medication refill processing. Your efforts will directly contribute to ensuring timely and seamless access to high-quality care for our patients.



This is a full-time remote position, working Monday through Friday, approximately 40 hours per week. Candidates must be available during Pacific Standard Time (PST) hours.



Key Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Conduct new patient screenings - (mental health experience required).

‚Ä¢ Coordinate and schedule patient appointments and procedures.

‚Ä¢ Verify patient insurance eligibility and benefit details

‚Ä¢ Accurately collect and update patient demographic and insurance information.

‚Ä¢ Ensure timely collection and completion of enrollment forms and follow up on missing information or documentation

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with clinical and administrative teams to support efficient, high-quality, cost-effective care.

‚Ä¢ Assisting patients in understanding Pacific Mind Health policies, procedures, and services, when necessary.

‚Ä¢ Process, verify and manage incoming refill requests from patients and providers.

‚Ä¢ Handle medication prior authorizations requests, when needed.

‚Ä¢ Assisting patients in understanding Pacific Mind Health policies, procedures, and services, when necessary.

‚Ä¢ Communicate with patients about denied refill requests and coordinate follow-up appointments.

‚Ä¢ Perform various administrative responsibilities as assigned



Qualifications

‚Ä¢ 2+ years of recent medical office experience (required).

‚Ä¢ Experience and knowledge in mental health services (required).

‚Ä¢ At least 1 year of Pharmacy/Refills experience.

‚Ä¢ Registered Pharmacist (preferred).

‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.

‚Ä¢ Strong attention to detail and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and multitask in a fast-paced environment.

‚Ä¢ Commitment to delivering a positive and professional patient experience.

‚Ä¢ Reliable, high-speed internet connection is required.



Additional Skills & Competencies

‚Ä¢ Communication: Clear, professional verbal and written (English) communication with patients, providers, and external vendors.

‚Ä¢ Self-Motivation: Proactive, adaptable, and able to work independently or as part of a remote team

‚Ä¢ Organization & Time Management: Able to manage multiple responsibilities and deadlines effectively

‚Ä¢ Tech Proficiency: Comfortable using:

o Electronic Medical Records (e.g., Tebra / Kareo)

o Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive)

o Microsoft Office (Word, Excel)

o Dropbox and other cloud-based tools

‚Ä¢ HIPAA Compliance: Strong understanding and commitment to patient privacy and confidentiality

‚Ä¢ Patient Billing: Ability to explain financial responsibilities to patients and assist with billing inquiries or disputes professionally



Applications Instructions

If you are interested in this opportunity, we kindly ask that you submit a brief video introduction including the following:

‚Ä¢ A short introduction about yourself,

‚Ä¢ Your current role or professional background/situation.

‚Ä¢ A brief overview of your relevant experience and qualifications.

‚Ä¢ What are you looking for in your next role?

‚Ä¢ Why are you interested in Pacific Mind Health?

‚Ä¢ Why do you believe you‚Äôre a great fit for this position?

‚Ä¢ Your availability, preferred working hours, and time zone.



In addition to your video submission, please ensure that you apply through the OnlineJobs.ph platform.



You may send your video via
 to 
 or provide a link to your video via Dropbox, Google Drive, or another secure file-hosting platform.



We appreciate your interest and look forward to reviewing your application. Qualified candidates will be contacted to schedule an interview.



About Pacific Mind Health

Our mission is to deliver exceptional, patient-centered mental health care through innovation, compassion, and evidence-based treatments. We foster a supportive and inclusive environment, where both our patients and tea
mbers can thrive. Our goal is to be an oasis of healing and a sanctuary of hope, empowering individuals to achieve whole-person wellness.



We embrace understanding, flexibility, and responsiveness as we provide compassionate and empathetic care, leveraging the latest advancements in Psychiatry. Our goal is to improve mental health outcomes, reduce stigma, and provide comprehensive treatment options tailored to each patient‚Äôs needs.



Our Values

‚Ä¢ Compassion ‚Äì Empathetic, Patient-Centered Care

‚Ä¢ Growth ‚Äì Continuous Learning & Employee Development

‚Ä¢ Integrity ‚Äì Honesty, Trust, & Ethical practices

‚Ä¢ Teamwork ‚Äì Collaboration & Respect

‚Ä¢ Excellence ‚Äì Raising the Standard of Care



Work with us to help people Feel Better. Live Better.

title: Credit Repair Case Manager ‚Äì Credit Cloud Experience Preferred (Long-Term)
description:
Company:

JM Financial Solutions ‚Äì U.S.-based credit consulting company



Overview

We are hiring an experienced Credit Repair Case Manager to manage client files using Credit Cloud software. This role includes reviewing credit reports, preparing disputes, tracking bureau responses, and updating client cases.

This position involves handling highly sensitive personal and financial information. We are looking for someone professional, ethical, detail-oriented, and experienced in working with confidential client data.

This is a long-term opportunity for someone who understands the credit repair process and can work independently inside Credit Cloud.



Responsibilities:

Manage client accounts inside Credit Cloud

Prepare and send dispute letters

Track bureau responses and update dispute rounds

Maintain detailed and accurate client notes

Upload and manage client documents

Monitor timelines for bureau responses

Provide internal updates on client progress

Data Security & Confidentiality Requirements

This role requires handling sensitive client information including:

Full credit reports

Social Security Numbers

Dates of birth

Addresses and employment data

Financial account information

The selected candidate must:

Be comfortable signing a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)

Follow strict data privacy and security procedures

Maintain complete confidentiality at all times

Use secure systems and private workspaces

Never store or share client data outside approved platforms

Any breach of confidentiality will result in immediate termination.



Requirements:

Prior experience in credit repair or dispute processing

Experience using Credit Cloud (preferred)

Strong understanding of FCRA basics

Ability to analyze and prioritize negative accounts

Strong written English skills

Highly organized and detail-oriented

Reliable internet connection and secure work environment



To Apply:

Describe your experience with credit repair and/or Credit Cloud.

Explain how you d
 which accounts to dispute first.

Confirm you are comfortable handling sensitive financial data and signing an NDA.

Include the word ‚ÄúCASE‚Äù at the top of your application. Send everything to 



Compensation

$60/Week. Long-term opportunity with room for growth.

Molecular Biology Products Inc. (MBP) is a growing North American supplier of molecular biology reagents and lab consumables serving academic, biotech, and pharmaceutical laboratories. We help research teams reduce cost per reaction through strategic sourcing and high-quality alternatives to major brands.



We are seeking a confident, energetic Sales Development Representative (SDR) whose primary role is outbound cold calling to research labs and procurement teams across North America.

title: Senior MSP Engineer
description:
PLEASE READ: If you would like to apply and learn more about the role, please use the link below.





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



itGenius is a leading cloud technology consulting firm and Google‚Äôs top partner in Australia. We help SMBs globally transform using Google Workspace, AI, and automation. We are looking for an "A-Player" Senior MSP Engineer to lead technical delivery and mentor our growing team.



Why You‚Äôll Love Working With Us



Competitive Pay: Performance bonuses, December bonus, and annual salary increases.

Time Off: Paid leaves and observance of National/Local holidays.

Growth: Dedicated training budget and clear career pathways.

Culture: Annual team conferences (travel/food/hotel covered) and a people-first hybrid environment.

Stability: Government-mandated benefits and HMO.



The Role

You will provide high-level (L2/L3) support, network management, and infrastructure solutions. This is a "player-coach" role‚Äîyou will handle complex technical escalations while mentoring junior engineers to improve team productivity.



Key Responsibilities:

- Advanced Support: Resolve complex server (Windows/Linux/macOS) and workstation issues via Datto RMM.

- Networking: Lead the install/config of LAN/WAN, VLANs, and VPNs (specializing in Ubiquiti/UniFi, Cisco, and Juniper).

- Cloud & Security: Administer Google Workspace and M365 environments; lead migrations and security audits (SMB 1001 standards).

- Leadership: Act as a technical escalation point, mentor junior staff, and drive 10% YOY productivity improvements.



Qualifications:

Experience: 5+ years in an MSP or IT Support environment.

Technical Depth: Strong L3 background in networking (VPNs, Firewalls, Routing) and Cloud (Google Workspace/M365).

Hardware: Hands-on experience with UniFi/Ubiquiti is essential.

Tools: Proficient with RMM/PSA tools (Datto RMM, Autotask, IT Glue).

Leadership: Proven experience mentoring or leading small technical teams.

Communication: Excellent English for client-facing and internal collaboration.

title: Senior Account Manager
description:
PLEASE READ: If you would like to apply and learn more about the role, please use the link below.





---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Come join our dynamic, award-winning cloud technology consulting firm!



Are you passionate about empowering small businesses to achieve their greatest potential through technology? 



We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Account Manager to be the trusted partner for our clients, driving retention, satisfaction, and revenue growth. If you‚Äôre passionate about technology, problem-solving, and making a real impact, this is your chance to shine.



We‚Äôre itGenius, a leading cloud technology consulting firm and Google‚Äôs top partner in Australia. For over a decade, we‚Äôve helped small and mid-sized businesses across the globe transform how they work with Google Workspace, AI, and automation. Our business model combines consulting expertise with scalable managed services that empower modern teams to do their best work.



If you're an A-player‚Äîapply now!



Why You‚Äôll Love Working With Us



We don‚Äôt just offer a job‚Äîwe offer a career with exceptional rewards, growth opportunities, and a people-first culture. Here's what you‚Äôll get:



Competitive Compensation & Bonuses:

- December Bonus

- Performance Incentive Bonus

- Annual Salary Increases



Time Off That Matters:

- Paid Leaves

- Paid National/Local Holidays



Work & Life Experiences You'll Remember:

- Annual Team Conferences & Events (travel, food, accommodation covered)



Investing in Your Growth:

- Training & Development Budget

- Career Growth Pathways



Support to Help You Thrive:

- Government-Mandated Benefits/ HMO





Reports To: Head of Sales & Accounts



Job Overview: 



As a Senior Account Manager, you will be at the forefront of this mission, acting as a trusted partner and strategic advisor to our valued clients.



You will be instrumental in ensuring their continued success, identifying opportunities for them to leverage technology more effectively. This role is about building lasting relationships, driving mutual growth, and ensuring our clients experience the "Amazon Prime" of IT service - effortless, responsive and world class. 



You will be directly accountable for client retention, satisfaction, and the growth of your assigned accounts, contributing significantly to itGenius's 10-year goal of becoming the global leader in remote-delivered IT services to the SMB market.



Accountabilities



The Senior Account Manager is specifically accountable for the following measurable objectives within their assigned client portfolio:



Holding the Game Plan: Accountable for holding a clients long term objectives and ensuring the plan is constantly moved forward over time via quarterly reviews.



Strategic Client Partnership: Holding strategic relationships with key decision-makers within assigned client accounts, positioning itGenius as a trusted technology partner.



Client Retention & Satisfaction: Accountable for maintaining high levels of client satisfaction and ensuring the retention of assigned client accounts.



Revenue Growth: Accountable for identifying and securing opportunities for revenue growth through upsell and cross-sell within their assigned client portfolio.





Key Responsibilities:



To achieve the above accountabilities, the Senior Account Manager will perform the following day-to-day activities:



Relationship Management: Proactively engage with assigned clients through regular meetings (virtual and in-person where appropriate), calls, and
 communications to understand their evolving business needs and technology landscape.



Needs Assessment & Solution Proposal: Conduct thorough needs analyses to identify client challenges and opportunities, and present tailored IT solutions and services that align with their strategic objectives and our service offerings.



Sales & Negotiation: Prepare and deliver proposals, negotiate contracts, and manage the sales cycle for upsell and cross-sell opportunities within existing accounts to achieve revenue targets.



Client Advocacy & Issue Resolution: Act as the primary point of contact for assigned clients, advocating for their needs internally and collaborating with the technical, support, and project teams to ensure timely and effective resolution of any issues or escalations.



Account Planning & Review: Develop and maintain comprehensive account plans for each assigned client, including key contacts, service history, future opportunities, and conduct regular business reviews to demonstrate value and align on future strategies.



CRM Management & Reporting: Maintain accurate and up-to-date client information, communication logs, and sales pipeline data within the CRM system. Prepare and present regular reports on account health, sales performance, and client satisfaction to the Head of Strategic Sales.



Tea
ntoring: Serve as a subject matter expert and mentor to Junior Account Managers and Sales Representatives, assisting in their professional development and contributing to team best practices.



Market Awareness: Stay informed about industry trends, technological advancements, and the competitive landscape to better advise clients and identify new opportunities.





Required Qualifications & Skills



Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Marketing, IT, or related field

5‚Äì8+ years in account management, sales, or client services, ideally in IT/technology/SaaS. 

Proven track record in client retention, revenue growth, and account expansion.

Client Relationship & Strategy: Build trusted partnerships with senior decision-makers. Develop account plans, conduct business reviews, and identify growth opportunities.

Sales & Solution Selling: Skilled in proposal creation, contract negotiation, upsell/cross-sell, and delivering tailored IT solutions.

Communication & Collaboration: Excellent verbal and written skills; adept at presenting to executives and working seamlessly with internal teams.

CRM & Reporting: Proficient in CRM tools for tracking accounts, pipeline management, and reporting on KPIs.

Leadership & Mentoring: Mentor junior account managers and contribute to process improvements.

Behavioral Competencies: Proactive, innovative, accountable, collaborative, and trusted.





Work Schedule



8-hour shift

Morning shift

Monday to Friday

Weekends off

Observance of Philippine holiday

Permanent Work Form Home





You‚Äôll thrive here if you‚Äôre interested in:



The evolving world of cloud-based work (Google Workspace, Google Drive, Gmail, etc.)

Supporting small business growth (1‚Äì30 employees)

Applying technology to improve productivity and collaboration

title: Marketing Project Manager (Growth Ops)
description:
PLEASE READ: If you would like to apply and learn more about the role, please use the link below.





---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Mission: Helping Small Businesses Scale through Technology



At itGenius, we believe technology is the ultimate multiplier for growth. As a premier Google Workspace partner, we‚Äôve spent 15 years helping over 5,000 business owners transition from startup chaos to scalable, efficient operations with Google Workspace and other cloud tools.



We are currently building a global, high-volume, systems-first consultancy. To achieve this, we need a Marketing Project Manager who views marketing as an engineering challenge‚Äîfocusing on building the ‚Äúpipes‚Äù that drive consistent, global growth.



The Role: Strategic Execution & Workflow Management

We prioritize data-driven execution over traditional marketing ‚Äúfluff.‚Äù



Reporting directly to the Chief of Growth, your role is to bridge the gap between high-level strategy and tactical output. You won‚Äôt be managing a large internal team; instead, you will orchestrate a network of specialist contractors and automated systems to ensure our organic growth engine‚Äîprimarily driven by our high-authority YouTube channel‚Äîis running at peak performance.



? Why Join Our High-Performance Team?

We offer a remote-first culture that values systems, clarity, and measurable results.



Work From Anywhere: Permanent work-from-home (aligned with Philippine Time).

Clear Career Growth: Budget for professional certifications and a defined path toward senior leadership.

Performance-Based Rewards: A monthly success bonus tied directly to the achievement of your KPIs.

Dynamic Culture: Annual team conferences (past locations include Boracay) and a focus on holistic well-being.

Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive compensation, health allowances, and tech support for your home office.





Core Responsibilities

You will oversee the marketing portfolio, ensuring every project is clearly defined, properly resourced, and delivered on schedule.



1. Content Strategy & Production Management: Direct our external editors and copywriters. Your task is to ensure all content aligns with our brand voice‚Äîthe ‚ÄúCalm Expert Guide‚Äù‚Äîand effectively solves real-world business problems for our audience.

2. Growth Research & Competitive Analysis: Oversee our YouTube and search research process. You will identify high-demand topics and work with creatives to package them into high-performing titles and thumbnails.

3. Customer Lifecycle & Marketing Automation: Manage and optimize the customer journey within our CRM (Intercom). You will build and refine automated nurture sequences that guide prospects through our service tiers.

4. Technical SEO Coordination: Collaborate with our Engineering team to ensure our web properties remain healthy, crawlable, and optimized for the next generation of AI-driven search.

5. Performance Analytics: You will monitor and validate marketing KPIs bi-weekly, providing actionable insights during our Growth Sync meetings to improve ROI across all organic channels.





Who You Are (Fit & Mindset)

We look for candidates who demonstrate high ownership and a systems-first approach to problem-solving.



The ‚ÄúSystems Thinker‚Äù: You fundamentally understand B2B marketing funnels and how to manage complex workflows in a remote, international environment.

The ‚ÄúTech-Savvy Professional‚Äù: You are comfortable navigating new tools, directing technical implementations, and taking absolute accountability for project outcomes.

The ‚ÄúAccountable Executor‚Äù: You are a power-user of project management tools (Asana preferred). You can write clear, ‚Äúfail-proof‚Äù creative briefs and keep multiple contractors moving toward a single goal.





Required Qualifications

- 5+ Years in Marketing Operations or Project Management: Preferably within a B2B, SaaS, or tech consulting environment.

- Contractor Management: Proven experience sourcing, briefing, and holding external freelancers accountable for quality and deadlines.

- Tool Proficiency: Strong experience with Asana (or similar), CRM automation platforms, and an understanding of YouTube/Search analytics.

- Communication Excellence: You bring solutions, not just problems, and communicate with clarity and professionalism.





Work Schedule

- 8-hour shift, Philippine Time but flexible as some team are based in Europe.

- Monday to Friday (Weekends off).





Are You Ready to Scale with Us?

If you‚Äôre ready to build a scalable marketing machine that delivers tangible business impact, we‚Äôd love to meet you.



Apply Now and tell us: Which specific marketing system or workflow have you built that you are most proud of?

title: Senior Accountant - QA
description:
**CPA/CMA LICENSE REQUIRED**

**PERMANENT REMOTE (MUST HAVE OWN EQUIPMENT)**

**7-13 USD PER HOUR FIXED (Paid bi-weekly via Payoneer/Paypal)**

**40 HOURS PER WEEK (Weekends Off)**

**PACIFIC STANDARD TIME (Night Shift)**

**MONITASK TIME TRACKER**



About the Role

We are seeking an experienced accountant who wants to apply their skills in a dynamic, software-focused environment. Your primary responsibility will be to ensure that our PlumAccounting platform delivers accurate and reliable financial results. You will use your accounting expertise to review reports, reconcile data, and identify discrepancies while also learning and applying quality assurance (QA) processes such as system change review, bug documentation, and regression testing. This role offers the opportunity to stay rooted in accounting while gaining hands-on experience in software testing and product improvement.



Key Responsibilities

- Financial Data Validation & Reconciliation

- Review and validate accounting data and reports in both live and development environments.

- Verify journal entries, general ledger mappings, and account balances for accuracy.

- Reconcile imported data from integrated systems to ensure proper mapping and completeness.

- Prepare and reconcile P&L statements to confirm integration data matches source records.

- Evaluate accounting processes, system workflows, and reports to verify alignment with GAAP standards



Quality Assurance & Testing

- Participate in regression testing to ensure new features or updates do not introduce accounting errors.

- Test new accounting features for compliance with standard accounting principles.

- Document discrepancies with clear reproduction steps for the QA and development teams.

- Provide accounting-focused insights during system changes and software releases.



Process & Workflow Auditing

- Audit core accounting workflows such as AP/AR aging, bank reconciliations, and journal entries.

- Compare PlumAccounting functionality with competitor systems (e.g., QuickBooks, NetSuite, Xero) to identify opportunities for improvement.

- Maintain and update documentation for accounting processes and QA testing steps.

- Review and refine internal SOPs from both an accounting and QA perspective.



Collaboration & Communication

- Translate client accounting feedback into actionable tickets for developers.

- Participate in meetings with developers, QA, and implementation teams to ensure accounting accuracy is maintained.

- Act as a liaison between accounting operations and the software development team to bridge business context with technical execution.



Qualifications

- Bachelors degree in Accounting or Finance (CPA/CMA required).

- 3+ years of hands-on accounting experience, ideally with exposure to accounting systems.

- Strong understanding of GL, AP/AR, P&L, and journal entries.

- Proficient in Excel/Google Sheets for reconciliation and reporting.

- Strong attention to detail and analytical skills.

- No prior QA experience required. We will train you on QA tools, bug reporting, and testing methods.



Nice to Have

- Familiarity with accounting/ERP systems such as QuickBooks, NetSuite, or Xero.

- Experience in data reconciliation across systems.

- Exposure to QA or software testing processes.



What You'll Gain

- Apply your accounting expertise in a modern software development environment.

- Gain QA skills including test execution, regression testing, and defect tracking.

- Influence the development of an accounting platform used by multiple restaurants and franchises.

title: Real Estate Video Editor
description:
Real Estate Video Editor (Remote ‚Äî Overnight MST)

We work with many of the top-performing real estate agents and brokerages in the state, producing high-end listing videos that generate millions of views across MLS platforms and social media.

Long-term stability

Editors in this role receive:

Consistent, stable monthly income

Reliable long-term workload

Opportunity for salary increases based on performance and tenure

Long-term role within a fast-growing, professional media company

Our current top editors earn near the top of this salary range.



Required Skills

Advanced proficiency in Final Cut Pro

Strong cinematic pacing and editing ability

Excellent time management

Ability to meet strict overnight deadlines

Reliable high-speed internet

Computer capable of editing 4K footage smoothly

Strong attention to detail



Preferred Experience

Real estate video editing experience

High-volume editing workflow experience



Schedule Requirement (Critical)

This role operates on Mountain Time (MST):

Footage received: ~9:00 PM MST

This Role Is Ideal For Editors Who Want:

Stable, consistent monthly income

Long-term professional role

High volume of consistent work

Clear expectations and organized workflows

Opportunity to grow with a rapidly expanding company



Application Process

Editing software used

Computer specifications

Internet speed test screenshot

We are selective in hiring and only bring on editors who meet our quality and reliability standards. Our goal is to build a small team of elite, long-term editors.

title: Google Ads Specialist
description:

This role is for someone who truly specializes in Google Ads.  Google Ads is your core skill and you understand it deeply.



You will be responsible for strategy, setup, optimization, tracking, and performance. We are starting with one account, with the opportunity to manage multiple accounts as results prove out.

- Building and managing Google Ads campaigns

- Structuring accounts properly from day one

- Keyword research, match types, negative keyword strategy, and search intent mapping

- Conversion tracking setup using Google Tag Manager and GA4

- Understanding attribution, assisted conversions, and funnel behavior

- Writing high-converting ad copy aligned with search intent

- Ongoing optimization for CPA, ROAS, and efficiency

- Comfortable analyzing data and making performance-based decisions

Available to work between 9am and 5pm Eastern Time



Comfortable using AI tools to improve workflows, analysis, or ad performance

Start your message with the word Jamal

 when to scale spend versus optimize further

What Success Looks Like

- Ownership over results, not excuses



If you follow the instructions and your experience matches, we look forward to reviewing your application.

title: Instagram & TikTok Organic Growth Strategist
description:

This is not entry level. We are looking for someone who understands how organic content actually drives growth, attention, and sales on IG and TikTok.



You will own the strategy, messaging, and performance of the account. Our team will handle filming and editing. You are responsible for direction, copy, creative angles, and results. (Our own AI will help with some of the strategy).



If you are not confident leading an account end-to-end, this is not a fit.



What You‚Äôll Be Responsible For



Creating the full organic content strategy for Instagram and TikTok

Developing hooks, angles, scripts, and captions that convert attention into action

Writing strong short-form copy tailored to IG and TikTok behavior

Planning content calendars based on growth goals and testing frameworks

Analyzing performance metrics and iterating strategy weekly

Guiding creators on what to shoot and why

Staying current with platform trends while avoiding gimmicks

Owning the success or failure of the account



Must-Have Requirements

- Proven experience growing Instagram and or TikTok accounts organically

- Strong copywriting skills for short-form video and captions

- Strategic thinker who understands content funnels, not just viral posts

- Self-sufficient. You do not need hand-holding or daily direction

- Excellent spoken English with clear communication



Available to work between 9am and 5pm Eastern Time



Comfortable using AI tools to ideate, test, and improve content strategy



Important Application Instructions (Read Carefully)



To be considered, you MUST do the following:



Start your message with the word Jamal



Submit a short video answering the questions below



If you do NOT submit a video, your application will not be reviewed



No exceptions.



Video Questions You Must Answer

- Your video should be clear, structured, and specific.

- Briefly introduce yourself and your experience with Instagram and TikTok organic growth

- Walk through how you would approach growing an electrolyte brand organically from zero

- What content pillars would you start with and why

- How would you structure hooks in the first 3 seconds for this type of product

- How do you balance education, authority, and conversion in organic content

- What metrics do you track weekly to judge success on IG and TikTok

- Explain how you test and iterate content ideas over a 30-day period

- Describe a time you were fully responsible for an account‚Äôs growth and results

- How do you currently use AI to support your strategy, copy, or ideation

- What separates a high-performing organic account from an average one



What Success Looks Like

- Clear strategy from day one

- Strong direction for what content gets filmed

- Consistent improvement in reach, engagement, and conversions

- You think in systems, not random posts

- You take full ownership of outcomes



If you follow the instructions and your experience aligns, we are excited to review your application.

title: eBay Dropshipping Virtual Assistant

- Comfortable with Google Sheets & computers in general



- Reliable internet + availability for daily check-ins

- Orders processed same-day (or within agreed cutoff time)

- Quick, professional customer responses



Training + Tools



- We provide training, step-by-step SOPs, message templates, and tracking spreadsheets.



To Apply, please send:

- How many hours/days per week you can commit



- Confirmation you‚Äôre comfortable with: Google Sheets + following step-by-step SOPs

title: Community Manager & Social Media Strategist (Remote)
description:
**Job Title:** Community Manager & Social Media Strategist (Remote)



**Job Type:** Full-Time / Part-Time ‚Äì Remote

**Location:** Remote (Overseas applicants welcome)

**Working Hours:** Flexible, with availability aligned to US Eastern Time



---



## About the Role



We are looking for a **proactive and highly creative Community Manager** to manage and grow multiple brands across social media platforms.



This role is **not just posting content**. We are looking for someone who can **think strategically, propose ideas, manage content calendars, and help scale our brands** through consistent and high-quality execution.

‚Ä¢ Track performance and recommend improvements

---



## Requirements (Must Have)



‚Ä¢ Proven experience managing social media accounts professionally

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of **ChatGPT, Claude, Manus AI, or similar AI tools** for scripting, research, and workflow optimization

‚Ä¢ Ability to create content strategies and posting calendars

‚Ä¢ Strong scripting and content ideation skills

‚Ä¢ Highly proactive and solution-oriented mindset

‚Ä¢ Experience growing or managing brand accounts

‚Ä¢ Excellent written English

‚Ä¢ Organized, reliable, and detail-oriented

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently and deliver results



---



## Ideal Candidate Qualities



We are looking for someone who:

‚Ä¢ Brings ideas instead of waiting for instructions

‚Ä¢ Thinks like a brand strategist, not just a poster

‚Ä¢ Understands engagement and audience growth

‚Ä¢ Is creative and analytical

‚Ä¢ Can manage multiple brands efficiently

‚Ä¢ Takes ownership of results



---



## Platforms & Tools Experience (Preferred)



Experience with:

‚Ä¢ Instagram, TikTok,
, YouTube Shorts

‚Ä¢ Canva or design coordination tools

‚Ä¢ CRM or lead management systems

‚Ä¢ Analytics and reporting tools



---



## Compensation



Salary based on experience and skill level, with performance bonuses available for strong results and growth contributions.



---



## How to Apply



Please submit:



1. Resume or portfolio of accounts managed

2. Examples of content calendars or campaigns you have handled

3. Short video or voice introduction

4. List of AI and social media tools you have used

5. Description of accounts you have helped grow



Qualified candidates will be invited for an interview and strategy discussion.

title: Real Estate Transaction management and Assistant
description:
About Us



We are a dynamic, fast-growing real estate business that also operates across multiple related industries, requiring a highly skilled and versatile assistant to support both professional and personal operations. Our team values precision, efficiency, and creativity, and we are looking for someone who can seamlessly adapt to a wide variety of tasks with excellence.



Position Overview



The Real Estate & Executive Personal Assistant will play a pivotal role in managing business operations, personal tasks, and client relations. This individual must be tech-savvy, highly organized, a fast learner, and capable of working independently while supporting multiple projects. You will be expected to handle advanced CRM functions, marketing tasks, video editing, scheduling, and more‚Äîalways with a proactive and solution-focused approach.



Key Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ CRM & Automation Management:

‚Ä¢ Expert-level use of Go High-Level to manage leads, pipelines, and automated workflows.

‚Ä¢ Manage and optimize CRM systems for client follow-ups, campaigns, and marketing automations.

‚Ä¢ Real Estate Operations:

‚Ä¢ Work with real estate software (MLS, DocuSign Dotloop, etc.).

‚Ä¢ Handle property listings and buyers transactions , data entry, document preparation, and compliance tracking.

‚Ä¢ Organize and maintain real estate calendars, showing schedules, and closing timelines.

‚Ä¢ Marketing & Media:

‚Ä¢ Manage social media accounts across multiple platforms, including content creation, posting, and engagement.

‚Ä¢ Edit videos for property listings, social media, and brand promotion.

‚Ä¢ Administrative Support:

‚Ä¢ Manage executive schedules, appointments, travel arrangements, and deadlines.

‚Ä¢ Maintain and organize files, both digital and physical.

‚Ä¢ Coordinate with vendors, clients, and referral networks (including Referral Exchange).

‚Ä¢Call clients



Qualifications

‚Ä¢ Required Skills & Experience:

‚Ä¢ Expert in Go High-Level CRM and automations.

‚Ä¢ Proficient in real estate transaction management software.

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in social media management, video editing, and graphic design

‚Ä¢ Strong scheduling and organizational skills.

‚Ä¢ Proficient in Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, and other productivity tools.

‚Ä¢ Personal Attributes:

‚Ä¢ Fast learner with the ability to work independently.

‚Ä¢ Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.

‚Ä¢ Excellent time management and multitasking skills.

‚Ä¢ High attention to detail and problem-solving ability.

‚Ä¢ Willingness to take on varied tasks as business needs change.



Preferred Qualifications

‚Ä¢ Experience in a real estate office or supporting a real estate professional.

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of marketing analytics tools and reporting.

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with short-term rental management or commercial real estate processes.



Compensation & Benefits

‚Ä¢ Competitive pay based on experience.

‚Ä¢ 2 different compensation plans

‚Ä¢ Opportunities for skill development and career growth.

title: Instagram Setter (Cold Outreach + DM Qualification) - For HUGE Influencers
description:
Instagram Setter (Cold Outreach + DM Qualification)

ScaleUp Systems is hiring ASAP



We run high performance IG sales systems for big fitness creators. Your job is simple to understand and hard to do well: start real conversations, qualify fast, book calls, and keep leads moving.



Role

Instagram Setter (Fitness Coaching niche)

Remote, performance driven, long term



What you‚Äôll do daily

Cold outreach on influencer accounts (targeted, not spam)

Start DMs, build rapport, qualify, and book calls

Follow up like a machine (reminders, nudges, reschedules, ‚Äúlost leads‚Äù reactivation)

Confirm booked calls and improve show up rate

Supportive tasks inside the DM pipeline (tagging, notes, updating Sheets/CRM, handoff to closer team)

Write clean, human messages that fit the creator‚Äôs tone



What we‚Äôre looking for

Real experience setting appointments via Instagram DMs (proof matters)

Strong understanding of cold outreach psychology (hook, context, value, clear next step)

Fitness coaching market knowledge is a big plus

Excellent written English (German is a plus)

Fast, consistent, disciplined follow up habits

You can handle targets, tracking, and feedback without ego

You do NOT rely on AI to ‚Äúdo the thinking‚Äù for you (tools are fine, but skill comes first)



Nice to have

Experience with high ticket coaching offers

Basic CRM / tracking skills (Google Sheets, simple pipelines)

Confidence handling objections in DMs until the handoff point



Compensation

Performance based (with clear KPIs). Option for a fixed base depending on experience and availability. If you‚Äôre good, you‚Äôll never worry about workload or growth here.



Hiring process (read carefully)

Phase 1: Written application screening

Your first message is your first test. Low effort applications get ignored.

Phase 2: Short intro call

Phase 3: Practical test

You‚Äôll complete a short DM scenario + write outreach openers and follow ups. This must be done without AI assistance. We want to see your raw skill.



How to apply (copy this and send it as your application message)



1.? ?Name + country + timezone

2.? ?Weekly availability (hours)

3.? ?Your setter experience (who you set for, niche, volume)

4.? ?Results you can back up (booked calls per day/week, show up rate, anything measurable)

5.? ?3 cold outreach openers for a fitness coaching lead (short, human, non cringe)

7.? ?Why you want this role and why you‚Äôll win here (max 5 lines)

8. If you can share a picture of you aswell

9. Maybe share some KPIs if you have them





If you can write DMs that actually convert and you‚Äôre consistent with follow ups, you‚Äôll fit in perfectly.

Please only serious people that are also trustworthy and already have knowledge.
salary: up to 5.000$ a month or even more

title: Digital Production Project Manager
description:
About the Role:

We are a growing portfolio of online media brands serving engaged audiences across meaningful niches including mental health, personal development, and wellness. Our digital newsletters reach hundreds of thousands of readers daily, delivering valuable content that helps people live better lives.



We're looking for an organized, detail-oriented Project Manager to oversee the production of our digital

products. This is a part-time to full-time position (with potential to grow) perfect for someone who thrives on

keeping projects moving, enjoys working with creative freelancers, and has an eagle eye for quality.





You'll be the central point of contact between our team and our network of freelance designers‚Äîensuring

projects flow smoothly from brief to final delivery.



What You‚Äôll Be Doing:

1. Project Pipeline Management

‚Ä¢ Manage and maintain our Trello-based project workflow across 7 stages (Backlog ? Paid & Complete)

‚Ä¢ Release new projects from the backlog and announce availability to the freelancer pool

‚Ä¢ Assign projects to appropriate designers based on skills, availability, and workload

‚Ä¢ Monitor project timelines and ensure deadlines are met

2. Quality Control & Feedback

‚Ä¢ Review all submitted design files (PDFs, Canva files, source files) for quality and accuracy

‚Ä¢ Provide clear, constructive feedback and revision notes when needed

‚Ä¢ Approve final deliverables that meet our standards

‚Ä¢ Ensure all checklist items are completed before sign-off

3. Freelancer Coordination

‚Ä¢ Communicate with freelancers via Trello comments and WhatsApp group announcements

‚Ä¢ Answer questions, clarify briefs, and provide guidance as needed

‚Ä¢ Follow up on overdue projects and manage deadline extensions

‚Ä¢ Onboard new freelancers to our workflow and systems

4. Administrative Duties

‚Ä¢ Track project statuses and maintain organized records

‚Ä¢ Coordinate payment processing (weekly/bi-weekly schedules)

‚Ä¢ Flag issues, bottlenecks, or underperforming freelancers to leadership

‚Ä¢ Continuously improve workflows and documentation



Requirements:

‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience in project management, production coordination, or traffic management

‚Ä¢ Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail

‚Ä¢ Strong written communication skills (clear, professional, and friendly)

‚Ä¢ Experience working with freelancers or remote creative teams

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Trello (or similar project management tools)

‚Ä¢ Ability to review design files and provide actionable feedback

‚Ä¢ Self-motivated and comfortable working independently

‚Ä¢ Reliable internet connection and availability during core business hours



Ideal Candidate:

‚Ä¢ Background in graphic design, print production, or digital products

‚Ä¢ Experience with Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar design tools

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with print-ready file specifications

‚Ä¢ Previous experience managing high-volume, fast-turnaround projects





Work Details:

Hours:  Part-time (15‚Äì25 hrs/week) with potential to grow to full-time

Location: Remote

Schedule: Flexible, but must be available for daily check-ins and 48-hour review turnarounds





Why Join Us?

- Flexible remote work ‚Äî Work from anywhere on your schedule

- Growth potential ‚Äî Start part-time with opportunity to expand

- Creative environment ‚Äî Work alongside talented designers on diverse projects

- Streamlined systems ‚Äî We have clear processes; you'll help make them even better

title: Freelance Graphic Designer

title: CRM and Sales Operations Lead ‚Äì UK B2B Technology Platform
description:
Job Title

Revenue Operations Lead ‚Äì UK B2B Infrastructure Platform



Salary: Compensation based on CRM expertise and revenue operations experience.



Location

Remote ‚Äì Philippines (UK Time Overlap Required)



Employment Type

Full-Time (40 hours per week)

Must work UK hours (approximately 9:00am‚Äì5:00pm UK time)



About the Company



We are a UK-based B2B technology platform operating in a regulated professional services market. Our product modernises a national submission workflow currently dominated by legacy systems.



We are in a rapid growth phase, executing high-volume founder-led outbound and building a structured revenue engine. Precision, discipline and operational control are critical.



This is not a general virtual assistant role. This is a high-responsibility revenue operations position.



The Mission



You will take full ownership of CRM discipline, pipeline control and real-time follow-up execution.



Your responsibility is to ensure:



No lead is lost.



Every call outcome is logged accurately.



Every next action is scheduled.



Every follow-up is executed within 15 minutes.



Every opportunity is surfaced before deadline.



The founder‚Äôs outbound engine operates without leakage.



You are the operational control tower.



Core Responsibilities



CRM Management and Pipeline Discipline



Log and categorise 50‚Äì80 daily call outcomes accurately inside Attio (or equivalent CRM).



Maintain strict pipeline staging and structured data entry.



Ensure every record contains required fields including timeline, segmentation tags and next action date.



Monitor stagnation rules (48‚Äì72 hour alerts).



Audit CRM daily for missing data or broken workflows.



Real-Time Follow-Up Execution



Send personalised follow-up
s within 15 minutes of call completion.



Trigger SMS support messages when required.



Prepare LinkedIn follow-up touchpoints when instructed.



Ensure no delay between call and structured follow-up.



Pipeline Prioritisation



Build daily priority call lists.



Surface urgent opportunities based on timeline triggers.



Flag incomplete records requiring clarification.



Identify stalled opportunities requiring intervention.



Data Research and List Expansion



Build and enrich B2B contact lists.



Use tools such as Apollo, Snov, LinkedIn and data enrichment platforms.



Deduplicate and validate
 data.



Segment database by geography, role and firm size.



Maintain structured import processes into CRM.



Reporting and Insight



Produce weekly pipeline summaries including stage counts and stagnation metrics.



Identify leakage points in follow-up process.



Suggest improvements to CRM workflows and automation triggers.



Support implementation of automation tools such as Zapier.



Required Experience



Strong experience using CRM systems such as HubSpot, Salesforce, Attio, Pipedrive or similar.



Excellent written English suitable for UK professional audiences.



High attention to detail and structured thinking.



Experience in sales operations, revenue operations or pipeline management preferred.



Comfortable working UK hours and responding in real time.



Personal Attributes



Process-driven and disciplined.



Calm under high activity.



Detail-obsessed and organised.



Able to manage high daily volume accurately.



Not primarily creative or design-focused.



This role requires operational precision rather than content creation.



Tools



You must be comfortable with:



CRM platforms



Google Sheets or Excel



 tools and automation systems



LinkedIn



Data enrichment tools



Basic workflow automation platforms



Working Hours



You must work UK hours approximately 9:00am‚Äì5:00pm UK time. This typically equates to 4:00pm‚Äì12:00am or 5:00pm‚Äì1:00am Philippines time depending on daylight saving.



Live overlap is required.



Compensation



Competitive compensation for high-calibre candidates based on experience and CRM expertise. Compensation will scale with performance.



Growth Opportunity



High performers can progress into senior revenue operations leadership as the platform scales.



Application Instructions



To apply, please submit:



A short explanation of how you would manage 80 daily call outcomes in a CRM without losing leads.



The CRM systems you have used and your level of proficiency.



A brief example of how you improved pipeline discipline in a previous role.



Shortlisted candidates will complete a paid practical test.

title: Executive Assistant - LONG TERM
description:
I am the owner of a high end vacation rental cleaning business based in the beautiful Rocky Mountains of Breckenridge Colorado.  We support luxury properties and are known for our reliability, professionalism and operational excellence.  I am seeking a highly intelligent, detail oriented Executive Assistant who will work directly with me and my team to help build, document and manage our operational systems.  

This is not a basic assistant role.  I am looking for someone who can help organize operations, build SOP's, audit workflows, identify inefficiencies, and help create structure as the company continues to grow.

Core responsibilities include: 

Document and organize Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's)

Help build and maintain our operational workspace in Notion or Asana (have not chosen one yet)

Convert existing processes into clear organized procedures

Continuously improve and refine systems

Monitor workflow and identify operational gaps

Track performance metrics and completion of operational tasks

Help ensure tea
mbers are following procedures correctly

Create reports and dashboards to track operational performance.

Identify inefficiencies and recommend improvements

help implement new systems and operational controls

Assist in organizing and supporting administrative team workflows

Help improve efficiency accountability and organization

Assist owner with operational coordination and special projects

Provide organizational and operational support



This role is ideal for someone who is highly organized and detail oriented. I am looking for a strong critical thinker and problem solver.  Someone who can work independently but be proactive and solution oriented.  Someone who enjoys building systems and processes.  Someone with strong written and verbal English skill and who is reliable, professional and committed long term.



I would prefer somebody with experience creating SOP's, and documenting processes.  Prior experience as an executive assistant a plus.  I am very easy to work with and am looking for somebody who can help me stay organized and take me to the next level.

Required Skills

What We Value

title: Cloud & Endpoint Support Engineer (Tier 2)
description:
Role Overview 

The Cloud & Endpoint Support Engineer (Tier 2) is responsible for day-to-day endpoint operations and Microsoft 365 support across multiple client environments. This is a hands-on role focused on consistent execution, endpoint hygiene, patching, troubleshooting, and clear documentation. 



Key Responsibilities 

‚Ä¢ Administer Microsoft 365 and core Azure/Entra ID services (user/mailbox management, Conditional Access changes, retention and mailbox policies). 

‚Ä¢ Configure and manage Intune, Autopilot, Group Policy, application deployments, and configuration baselines. 

‚Ä¢ Execute scheduled Windows and third-party patching, including reporting and remediation. 

‚Ä¢ Monitor and maintain endpoint security baselines and EDR/RMM agents (e.g., SentinelOne, Arctic Wolf, NinjaOne). 

‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot endpoint, mail flow, DNS, authentication (SPF, DKIM, DMARC), and basic firewall issues. 

‚Ä¢ Resolve Tier 2 escalations and collaborate with senior engineers for complex i
. 

‚Ä¢ Maintain runbooks for onboarding/offboarding, device builds, patching, and routine maintenance. 

‚Ä¢ Use PowerShell for basic automation, validation, and reporting. 

‚Ä¢ Document all work clearly and accurately. 

‚Ä¢ Serve as the primary, hands-on owner of scheduled maintenance windows‚Äîexecuting, validating, and documenting patching and maintenance activities‚Äîand perform emergency after-hours changes as required. 



Qualifications 

‚Ä¢ 3‚Äì5 years of experience supporting Microsoft 365 and Windows endpoints. 

‚Ä¢ Strong hands-on experience with Intune, Autopilot, Group Policy, and patching workflows. 

‚Ä¢ Experience with EDR/RMM tools in a support capacity. 

‚Ä¢ Solid troubleshooting and documentation skills. 

‚Ä¢ Clear and professional communication skills.

title: Motion Graphics Editor (Project-Based) | Explanatory Animation Specialist
description:
Job Overview:

We are looking for a high-level Motion Graphics Video Editor to produce 5-minute explanatory YouTube videos and high-engagement Shorts.



We provide the script, voiceover, and rough sketches/storyboards for the animations. Your job is to bring those sketches to life using professional 2D animation, kinetic typography, and clean transitions. If you only know how to cut B-roll and add subtitles, please do not apply.



The Work:



Long Form: ~5-minute videos. High density of custom animations/motion graphics (NOT just stock footage).



Short Form: 60-second vertical reels with high-energy movement and "Alex Hormozi" style or "Vox" style motion graphics.



Reference Style (Must match this quality): 



Requirements:



Advanced After Effects Skills: You must be able to animate icons, graphs, and text from scratch based on my sketches.



Premiere Pro Mastery: For the final assembly and sound design.



Visual Problem Solver: You should understand how to visualize a concept without me holding your hand through every frame.



Portfolio Required: You must show examples of explanatory/infographic animation you have personally built.



Compensation (Per Project):

We do NOT pay hourly. We pay a flat fee per completed project to reward efficiency and quality:



$100 - $150 per 5-minute Explanatory Video (depending on complexity).



$30 - $50 per edited Short/Reel.



Note: Rates are negotiable for top-tier talent who can execute with zero hand-holding.



How to Apply:



Start your message with the word "MOTION."



Attach a link to your portfolio/reel (specifically showing 2D animation).



Confirm that you are comfortable working from a storyboard/sketch.



What is your turnaround time for a 5-minute animated video once you receive the assets?

title: Help Desk Support Specialist
description:
Help Desk Support Specialist (Remote, Full-Time)



We‚Äôre a fast-moving, tech-forward team looking for a highly skilled IT pro.

We‚Äôre searching for a Help Desk Support Specialist with serious technical chops ‚Äî someone who thrives in dynamic environments, loves solving complex problems, and brings both depth and curiosity to their work. This isn‚Äôt a basic ticket-taker role. You‚Äôll be the person our team relies on to diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve issues across modern cloud platforms, networks, and devices.

If you‚Äôre energized by autonomy, ownership, and the chance to make a real impact, you‚Äôll fit right in.



Who We Are

We‚Äôre a lean, ambitious, and tech-driven team that operates with startup speed and zero bureaucracy. We move fast, collaborate openly, and constantly push to improve our systems and ourselves. Everyone here has a voice, and everyone‚Äôs ideas matter.



Our Culture



Built for Builders

We love people who go deep ‚Äî the ones who can‚Äôt resist digging into logs, optimizing workflows, or reverse-engineering a weird issue until it finally clicks. If you‚Äôre wired to figure things out, you‚Äôll thrive here.



Remote-First, Trust-Driven

We don‚Äôt micromanage. We give you ownership, flexibility, and the freedom to do your best work. What matters is impact, not hours.



Collaboration Without the Corporate Fluff

We communicate openly, help each other out, and jump in wherever needed. No politics, no silos, no ‚Äúthat‚Äôs not my job.‚Äù



Always Improving

We‚Äôre constantly refining our processes, tools, and documentation. If you see a better way to do something, we want you to run with it.



Tech-Forward Mindset

We‚Äôre not just support ‚Äî we‚Äôre problem-solvers, system thinkers, and technical strategists. Curiosity and experimentation are part of the job.



Human-Centered Support

Even with all the tech, we never forget the human side. We treat every user with patience, clarity, and respect.

title: Patent Attorney
description:
Patent Attorney ‚Äî Advanced Photovoltaic & Hybrid Energy Systems



Company: US Power

Location: Remote (U.S. preferred) | California-based collaboration a plus

Engagement: Contract with potential for long-term relationship

Compensation: Competitive hourly or fixed-fee structure based on experience



About US Power



US Power is a rapidly expanding energy platform focused on accelerating the adoption of next-generation solar and distributed energy technologies. We develop residential, commercial, and emerging utility-scale solutions while investing heavily in proprietary innovations that redefine how energy is generated, stored, and delivered.



We are currently advancing a novel hybrid solar energy generation technology integrating photovoltaic systems with additional energy-harvesting mechanisms. Following the successful filing of a provisional patent, we are seeking an exceptional patent attorney to lead the preparation and prosecution of our non-provisional application and help architect a durable intellectual property strategy.





Role Overview



We are looking for a highly technical Patent Attorney with demonstrated expertise in solar, semiconductor, materials science, or electro-mechanical technologies to partner with our executive and engineering teams.



This role goes beyond drafting ‚Äî we want a strategic thinker capable of identifying defensible claim structures, anticipating competitive workarounds, and building a scalable patent portfolio.





Key Responsibilities



Convert an existing provisional patent into a robust non-provisional application

Develop broad yet defensible independent claims with layered fallback positions

Identify opportunities for continuation patents and portfolio expansion

Perform targeted prior art searches and freedom-to-operate analyses

Translate complex engineering concepts into precise legal language

Advise leadership on IP strategy aligned with long-term company growth

Support potential international filings (PCT pathway preferred)

Collaborate directly with inventors and technical stakeholders





Required Qualifications



Registered U.S. Patent Attorney in good standing with the USPTO

Degree in Electrical Engineering, Materials Science, Physics, Mechanical Engineering, or similar technical field

5+ years prosecuting complex hardware or energy-related patents

Demonstrated experience drafting patents for:

? Photovoltaic systems

? Semiconductor technologies

? Hybrid energy generation

? Power electronics

? Electromechanical devices

? Advanced materials



Ability to understand schematics, engineering diagrams, and system architectures





Strongly Preferred



Direct experience with solar or renewable energy patents

Background working with venture-backed startups or high-growth technology companies

Familiarity with inverter technologies, battery integration, or grid-interactive systems

Experience building multi-patent portfolios from early-stage inventions

International filing strategy experience





What Success Looks Like



Within the first 90‚Äì120 days, the selected attorney will:



Deliver a high-quality non-provisional patent application

Establish a forward-looking IP protection strategy

Identify whitespace opportunities for additional filings

Help position US Power as a defensible technology leader





Why This Role Matters



This technology has the potential to influence the future architecture of distributed energy. The attorney selected for this role will play a pivotal part in protecting a platform that could scale across residential, commercial, and utility markets.





How to Apply



Please submit:



Resume or firm profile

Representative patent filings (energy or hardware preferred)

Brief description of your technical background

Estimated fee structure

Earliest availability

Send inquiries through here

We have a competitive culture where winning together is the standard.  We believe the when employees and customers both succeed everyone wins.  We want you to love what you do and proudly represent our company.



We reward great performance.  Great performers will have the opportunity to grow and increase their income.  



Key Responsibilities:

- Respond to client questions regarding coverage, claims and premiums via phone and
.

- Process endorsements, renewals, cancellations and policy changes

- Assist sales associates by helping with quotes, renewal processing, identifying cross-selling opportunities and onboarding calls    with new customers.

- Maintain accurate client records and documentation in our agency management system.



Traits Required:

- Detail oriented

- Calm under pressure

- Tech comfortable

- Coachable

This is generally a full time positions Monday-Friday from 9am - 5pm Central Standard Time

If you enjoy being trusted to run with tasks, spot inefficiencies, and contribute ideas to grow a business, this role is for you.

mber you manage is supported, productive, and accountable

title: Hiring Manager (Remote, CST)
description:
About us:

Buddy Moving is a Texas moving company. This role owns the day-to-day recruiting pipeline for Movers and Drivers ‚Äî from first contact to onboarding completion.



What you‚Äôll do (top priorities)

1) Own the JazzHR pipeline (Movers/Drivers)

Monitor new applicants throughout the day and respond fast

Keep stages updated, notes complete, and follow-ups scheduled

Maintain a steady pipeline so operations is always staffed



2) Fast outbound calling + phone screening

Call new applicants as soon as they apply

Run a structured phone screen and score candidates

Track call attempts, outcomes, and next steps in JazzHR



3) Schedule and run video interviews

Book video interviews quickly (based on phone screen results)

Conduct video interviews with professionalism and confidence

Manage confirmations + reminders to reduce no-shows



4) Trial Day coordination + post-trial closeout

Move qualified candidates into a Trial Day (Operations Manager runs the actual day)

Once Operations marks ‚ÄúPassed Trial,‚Äù run a 30-minute final details call (pay, schedule, expectations, start date)

Help facilitate onboarding and ensure completion (forms, IDs, agreements, training steps, etc.)



5) Reporting + continuous improvement

Provide a simple daily/weekly hiring update (pipeline counts, show rate, hires, blockers)

Flag issues early (low applicant volume, low show rate, pay misalignment, etc.)

Suggest small process improvements to improve speed and quality



Tools you‚Äôll use

JazzHR (ATS), Google Workspace (Docs/Sheets/Drive), Slack, Zoom/Google Meet, and a VoIP/phone calling tool.



Requirements (must-have)

2+ years experience in recruiting, staffing, or high-volume hiring coordination

Strong spoken English and professional phone/video presence (clear, confident, friendly)

Very organized with follow-ups and documentation (ATS notes, stages, calendars)

Can work 9:00am‚Äì6:00pm CST (Texas time) consistently

Reliable internet + backup plan, headset, and a quiet work setup



Nice-to-have

Hiring for hourly/field roles (drivers, movers, warehouse, home services, construction, logistics)

Experience using an ATS (JazzHR or similar) and structured interview scorecards

Experience coordinating onboarding requirements



Important notes

You will NOT handle banking or payment processing.

We want someone long-term who is consistent, proactive, and calm under pressure.

This role requires frequent outbound calls and live video interviews.



Success in the first 30‚Äì60 days looks like

New applicants are contacted quickly and consistently

Phone screens and video interviews are scheduled daily (pipeline stays full)

Trial Days are set up smoothly with clean handoffs to Operations

Onboarding completion rate is high and start dates are clear

You communicate clearly, escalate early, and don‚Äôt let tasks stall



To apply (required)

1) Confirm you can work Mon‚ÄìFri 9am‚Äì6pm CST

2) Tell us your internet speed + backup plan

3) Share your recruiting experience (ATS used, volume, industries, results)

4) Include the word ‚ÄúBUDDY‚Äù in your application subject line

5) Complete our short assessment + submit the mock interview video (instructions provided after you apply)

title: Customer Service Consultant (Work-from-Home)
description:
ABOUT US



We are a purpose-driven service company committed to assisting individuals through one of life‚Äôs most challenging times. At SuperCare, we believe that health and well-being should always come first. As a pioneering Australian company, we empower eligible individuals to access essential medical treatments by facilitating the early release of their Superannuation on compassionate grounds. For over a decade, we have been making a meaningful impact, helping thousands ease their financial burdens while prioritising their health.



With offices strategically located in Sydney and Canberra, we provide nationwide support to ensure our clients receive the care they need, wherever they are. As industry leader, we are committed to continuous innovation, delivering exceptional client experiences, and fostering a workplace culture that promotes professional growth and collaboration.



As we continue to grow, we are excited to invite an experienced and highly competent Customer Service Consultant to help with our mission of transforming lives.







THE ROLE



The Customer Service Consultant plays a pivotal role in ensuring client satisfaction and engagement. Responsible for managing a portfolio of assigned clients though each stage of the application process for the early release of Superannuation due to compassionate grounds. Ensure a seamless client experience through every touch point. Provide expert-level support to our clients, addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and going above and beyond to exceed expectations.



As a dedicated consultant, serve as the primary contact in addressing all client inquiries and concerns. Take ownership and accountable for a sustainable high level of performance in critical areas of (1) Client Engagement and (2) Service Delivery.



Ensure that clients are achieving their desired outcome as well as maximum value from SuperCare services. Nurture a Culture of Trust & Accountability by serving as a role model in reinforcing SuperCare Core Values and ethical behavior.



Provide valuable insights into continuous improvement of the service offerings as well as the Client Experience.







Responsibilities:



Review support documents to ensure compliance with ATO guidelines



Schedule the lodgement



Submit the application to the Australian Taxation Office (ATO)



Maintain regular updates with clients in each stage of the application process, including ATO approval, through various channels, including phone calls,
s, and SMS



Resolve all client inquiries and concerns with empathy, urgency, and professionalism



Uphold SuperCare policies and procedures while adhering to service level agreements (SLAs) with clients







THE PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS



At least 1 year of experience in a customer service role, preferably in a corporate setting within a service industry such as insurance and banking industries



Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build rapport with clients and colleagues



Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a keen attention to detail



Proficiency in using CRM and other relevant tools



Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities



A proactive approach to problem-solving and a strong commitment to delivering exceptional service while consistently ensuring compliance with all internal and external regulations



A client-first mindset with a strong sense of empathy and accountability







THE OFFER



Competitive compensation commensurate with experience



Opportunity for professional development and advancement within SuperCare



A dynamic and supportive work environment committed to an engaging Workforce Experience



Comprehensive training program





REQUIREMENTS:



Fast and reliable internet connection

Stable power supply with a backup power source, including UPS





HOW TO APPLY





If you are passionate about making a meaningful impact and thrive in a collaborative, innovative setting, we‚Äôd love to hear from you! Join us at SuperCare and be part of a team that is changing lives every single day. Apply now and take the next step in your career! Please send us your comprehensive resume.

Skills

What Success Looks Like

Treating each brand like it is your own business
